answerText: "Nevsky Prospect"[10] This Russian author wrote "Nevsky Prospect."  His other works include "The Overcoat," in which the ghost of Akaky Akakievich haunts St. Petersburg after his newly purchased suit is stolen.
heading: MUT |2012 | 1 | 19 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The first part of this work follows the life of Piskarev, who uses opium to treat his insomnia which he develops after following a beautiful woman to what turns out to be a brothel.  [10] Name this short story set on the title street, the second part of which features characters like Schiller and Hoffman, and follows Lieutenant Pirogov's attempts to seduce a married woman.
